Strategic Goal: Ensure a Prepared & Resilient City
Measure Title: Number of exercises led by DES staff
Measure Description: DES conducts a wide range of exercises to fit the training needs of city employees.  These exercises may be discussion based or operation based.
Measure Methodology: DBE are conducted on a regular basis, ranging from Workshops that are an informal learning environment In each type of exercise, documentation regarding date, type of exercise, and number of participants are maintained in an XL file by DEM.  Improvement items identified during the exercise will be tracked in the Master Improvement Plan.  The number of exercises will be reported bi-annually.

Measure Title: Pounds of non-electronic household hazardous waste properly managed and recycled or disposed of through Recology SF
Measure Description: Total Pounds of household hazardous waste and [non-electronic] universal wastes managed through all City-sponsored programs and Recology SF Loadcheck Program.

Strategic Goal: Leading on climate action
Measure Title: Floor area (in square feet)of existing commercial buildings which have reportedon energy efficiency by submitting the required Annual Energy Benchmark Summary, as required by Environment Code Chapter 20
Measure Description: Environment Code Chapter 20 requires commercial buildings of 10,000 gross sq ft and larger to (1) track and annually publicly report total energy use, and (2) obtain a professional energy efficiency audit identifying cost-effective opportunities for improvement at least once every 5 years.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Green Building Staff track and enforce compliance with San Francisco Environment Code Chapter 20. Timing: Annally report in July for the previous calendar year.

Strategic Goal: Leading on climate action
Measure Title: Total public zero emission vehicle charging and fueling stations
Measure Description: The number of electric vehicle chargers in San Francisco available to the public.
Measure Methodology: Public chargers are located at parking spaces designated by a property owner or lessee to be available to and accessible by the public. This metric includes Level 1 chargers, Level 2 chargers, and DC Fast chargers. It does not include EV chargers with restricted access, such as those available only to tenants or employees. This data is collected and reported by the California Energy Commission. For more details, visit their website at https://www.energy.ca.gov/data-reports/energy-insights/zero-emission-vehicle-and-charger-statistics
Data Notes: No public data notes.

Strategic Goal: Promoting healthy communities & ecosystems
Measure Title: Floor area (in square feet) of municipal building stock certified through an environmental rating system, such as LEED to lead and leverage interagency efforts to green San Francisco's built environment
Measure Description: Commercial building and residences that are designed and/or operated to meet rigorous green building standards can be certified under the Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design, GreenPoint Rated, or ENERGY STAR programs. This evaluation and certification by a recognized third party provides credible verification that a building has met high standards for energy efficiency and sustainability. Note that in contrast to most other metrics in this list, SF Environment staff influence but do not entirely control this metric. For example, for there to be newly constructed certified green buildings, it is of course necessary for new buildings need to be constructed. The decision to build green must occur at the outset of design, and years may elapse before the new building is delivered to market and certified.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Green Building Staff maintain records of certified municipal properties (tracking compliance with Environment Code Chapter 7) Timing: Annally report in July for the previous fiscal year.

Strategic Goal: Enhance Transparency Through Public Disclosure
Measure Title: Percentage of annual Statements of Economic Interests e-filed with the Ethics Commission on time
Measure Description: Department heads and members of City boards and commissions are required to file annual Statements of Economic Interests (SEIs) on April 1 of each year.  This measure compares the number of individuals who have been identified by the Ethics Commission as being required to file annual statements with the number of filings that are received by the Commission.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: The Ethics Commission maintains a database of the SEIs filed by department heads, members of boards, and commissions.  The Commission maintains the SEIs.  The Commission posts the names of filers and non-filers on its website. The Commission calculates the percentage of compliance by dividing the number of forms 700 filed by the total of individuals required to file. Timing: Annual SEIs are due on April 1 of each year.

Measure Methodology: Collection Method: The Ethics Commission maintains a database of the SEIs filed by department heads, members of boards, and commissions.  The Commission maintains the SEIs.  The Commission posts the names of filers and non-filers on its website. The Commission calculates the percentage of compliance by dividing the number of forms 700 filed by the total of individuals required to file. Timing: Annual SEIs are due on April 1 of each year.

Strategic Goal: Enhance Transparency Through Public Disclosure
Measure Title: Percentage of annual Statements of Economic Interests e-filed with the Ethics Commission on time

The Commission posts the names of filers and non-filers on its website. The Commission calculates the percentage of compliance by dividing the number of forms 700 filed by the total of individuals required to file. Timing: Annual SEIs are due on April 1 of each year.

Strategic Goal: Enhance Transparency Through Public Disclosure
Measure Title: Percentage of expected campaign finance statements (Form 460) filed on time
Measure Description: Under state law, the Commission serves as the filing officer for local candidates, ballot measure committees and general purpose committees. Commission staff processes both electronic and paper filings, including amendments, and logs them into a campaign database.  For the purpose of this performance measure, a statement is considered to be filed on time if a candidate/committee filed its statement on or before the statement deadline.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: The Commission keeps an electronic campaign log.  All paper statements submitted by campaign filers are kept in the Commission office. Timing: Active campaign committees generally file two semi-annual statements and, if they are involved in an election, two pre-election statements. There are other filing deadlines as well, such as quarterly deadlines that apply only to certain types of committees or committees that meet certain thresholds.   Timing: The data shown reflects campaign statements that are received by the filing deadlines that fall within the performance measure periods.

Strategic Goal: Enhance Transparency Through Public Disclosure
Measure Title: Percentage of identified lobbyists filing reports on a timely basis
Measure Description: The Commission maintains a database of the statements filed by lobbyists. This measure is calculated using the filing data in the electronic filing system.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Registered lobbyists file their reports with the Ethics Commission.   Timing: Prior to January 1, 2010, lobbyist reports were due on a quarterly basis.  Since January 1, 2010, lobbyists reports have been due on a monthly basis on the 15th of each month.

Strategic Goal: Increase Accountability in Government
Measure Title: Number of campaign committees and publicly financed candidate committees audited
Measure Description: All candidates who receive public funding are audited by the Ethics Commission. The Commission additionally selects non-publicly funded candidate committees from each election cycle for audi
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: The general practice of the Ethics Commission has been to conduct a random selection of committees for audit.  After an election, the Commission audits all candidates who received public financing.  More recently, the Commission has begun to conduct targeted audits of committees whose campaign reports show activities that appear not to conform to the law. Timing: Ethics Commission staff conducts audits throughout the year.

Strategic Goal: Create a dynamic, efficient, and financially secure organization
Measure Title: # of employees for whom performance appraisals were scheduled (FAM)
Measure Description: New measure requested by Mayor on 8/15/05.  This is the number of employees in a department for whom a performance appraisal is to be conducted.  DHR policy is that all permanent and provisional employees must have an annual appraisal.  For new employees, the first review shold be scheduled according to their applicable probationary period.  For other employees, reviews should be conducted every 12 months. Departments can do appraisals for temporary employees at their discretion.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Source:  FAM Personnel Office Timing:  Annual

Measure Title: # of employees for whom scheduled performance appraisals were completed (FAM)
Measure Description: New measure requested by Mayor on 8/15/05.  This is the number of applicable employees in a department for whom a performance appraisal was conducted amd completed during the fiscal year.  "Completed" means an appraisal form has been filled out and is in the employee's personnel file.  DHR policy is that all permanent and provisional employees must have an annual appraisal.  For new employees, the first review should be scheduled according to their applicable probationary period.  For other employees, reviews should be conducted every 12 months.   Departments can do appraisals for temporary employees at their discretion.

Strategic Goal: Create a welcoming and stimulating environment for all audiences
Measure Title: Number of participants in public programs
Measure Description: Participants in Education Department public programs, including Friday Nights at the de Young, Artist Studio, concerts, lectures, films, symposia, and others.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Participant counts at each program tracked via clicker counts at the museum entrance. Timing: Public programs are offered throughout the year. Compilation of program attendance completed every six months.

Strategic Goal: Support education and engagement programs
Measure Title: Number of all school children and youth participating in education programs
Measure Description: All San Francisco Bay Area schoolchildren and youth participating in Education Department programs, including tours, curriculum-supported visits, hands-on art making, and professional development/leadership building for teens.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Data captured for all school groups who make a reservation and participate in one of our many programs. Timing: School programs are offered throughout the academic year. Compilation of education program participation completed every six months.

Strategic Goal: Emphasize the Physical and Mental Health and Wellness of Department employees
Measure Title: Number of Battalion Based/In-Service training hours
Measure Description: Total hours of training per member including Battalion Training and Paramedic Training Program.  Note: PTP Training was not included in original measure. The Battalion Based Training Program, introduced in July 2000, has proved to be an effective mechanism for delivery of formalized training.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Hours calculated via monthly reports. Timing:  Data available monthly from reports and combined to produce mid-year and annual figures.

Strategic Goal: Prioritize Employee & Community Engagement
Measure Title: Number of citizens trained in emergency techniques and procedures
Measure Description: Defined by NFPA 1710.  Number of citizens trained in Neighborhood Emergency Response Team (NERT) and other programs such as CPR, Ham Radio censing, I.C.S., and Citywide drills.  This program contributes to victim prevention, community preparedness for disasters, and training the public in becoming an adjunct to City emergency services. This program clearly enhances services provided by the San Francisco Fire Department.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: NERT volunteers sign a waiver of liability protecting the SFFD during training activities.  Documents are filed and stored at SFFD Headquarters, Room 118. Timing:  Data collected by NERT staff as classes occur in a database. NERT program produces information for mid-year and end-of-year reports.

Strategic Goal: Prioritize Employee & Community Engagement
Measure Title: Number of public education presentations
Measure Description: Public events, meetings, workshops and seminars where the Fire Department provided training, recommendations, advice, and printed materials about fire/earthquake safety and/or information about other Fire Department Community Based Programs.  This does not include Fire Station Open House days.  While NERT information is provided, these are not NERT classes.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: A letter of request to the Chief of Department from the interested party is required for trainings and presentations.  After the request has been completed, a written report is made on Public Education Event Report Form 3350.  These letters and report forms are maintained at Fire Department Headquarters, 698 2nd Street, Room 313, Office of Community Affairs. Timing:  Information is collected as presentations occur and reported at mid-year and at year-end.

Strategic Goal: Provide the Highest Level of Service
Measure Title: Number of Code 2 (Non Emergency) Incidents
Measure Description: All  incidents responded to with the flow of traffic, without lights and sirens.  These calls include medical, fire and service calls.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Data is collected from the Emergency Communications Department's (ECD) 911 (Computer Aided Dispatch) CAD.  Raw CAD data is stored at the ECD.  CAD data analysis reports are stored at SFFD Headquarters. Timing:  Data is available daiily. Information is reported on twice a year.

Measure Title: Number of Code 2 (Non Emergency) Incidents
Measure Description: All  incidents responded to with the flow of traffic, without lights and sirens.  These calls include medical, fire and service calls.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Data is collected from the Emergency Communications Department's (ECD) 911 (Computer Aided Dispatch) CAD.  Raw CAD data is stored at the ECD.  CAD data analysis reports are stored at SFFD Headquarters. Timing:  Data is available daiily. Information is reported on twice a year.

Strategic Goal: Provide the Highest Level of Service
Measure Title: Number of fires extinguished
Measure Description: Number of fires encountered by units when arriving on scene.  Measures all fires.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Data is collected from the Department's  National Fire Incident Reporting System (NFIRS) Record Management System.  Raw  data is stored at the ECD.  NFIRS data analysis reports are stored at SFFD Headquarters. Timing:  Data is available daily. Information is reported on twice a year.

Strategic Goal: Provide the Highest Level of Service
Measure Title: Number of fires investigated
Measure Description: The Bureau of Fire Investigation (BFI) responds to service calls, investigates the origin and cause of (suspicious) fires, and processes documentation and litigation of incidents.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Data and statistics are compiled from the National Fire Incident Reporting System (NFIRS) data collection system.  Other statistics are provided by the District Attorney's Office and the San Francisco Police Department. Timing:  Data is collected daily and reported on monthly and biannually.

Strategic Goal: Provide the Highest Level of Service
Measure Title: Number of inspections made
Measure Description: Number of inspections completed.  Inspections include referrals, complaints, violation re-inspections, permit approval, school inspections, and high-rise building annual inspections.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Inspections tracked in Fire Prevention Database located at SFFD Headquarters. Timing:  Inspections are processed daily. Database reports are available as needed.

Strategic Goal: Provide the Highest Level of Service
Measure Title: Number of inspections resulting in violation
Measure Description: The BFP Inspection Team during the course of its various inspections may issue a Notice of Violation when a violation of the fire code and other related codes, standards, or ordinances has been disclosed.  A reinspection of the violation, which is charged against the property owner or violator, will be conducted until such time that the violation has been abated.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Tracked in database at Fire HQ Timing:  Information is processed daily. Database reports are available as needed.

Strategic Goal: Provide the Highest Level of Service
Measure Title: Number of new fire permits issued
Measure Description: The BFP's Permit Section is responsible for inspecting special occupancies and reviewing plans for events prior to issuance of a fire permit .  In cooperation with the Dept. of Public Health, the Section also inspects installation and removal of underground or aboveground fuel tanks.  The Section also conducts annual inspection of renewal permits collected for the SFFD by the License Bureau of the Tax Collector's Office.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: The Permit Section's secretary monitors and maintains records of all new permits issued by the Section.  The 4 inspectors assigned to the Section submits inspection reports that are entered into the inspection database. Timing:  Permits are processed daily. Database reports are available as needed.

Strategic Goal: Provide the Highest Level of Service
Measure Title: Number of plans reviewed and approved
Measure Description: The BFP's Plan Check Section is assigned to check plans for alterations and new construction of buildings for compliance with the law and ordinances related to egress, fire protection, and fire spread control.  The Section also provides technical information to the public, conducts water flow tests, and attends pre-application meetings for input.  The processing of construction plans produces inspection for the BFP Inspection Team, which in return generates revenue.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: The Plan Check Section has an office at Dept. of Building Inspection on Mission Street and shares a database with DBI on plans.  The DBI collects fees for the SFFD.  The SFFD also collects additional fees (when needed) for the required inspection of the job. Timing:  Permits are processed daily. Database reports are available as needed.

Strategic Goal: Provide the Highest Level of Service
Measure Title: Number of violation re-inspections made
Measure Description: The BFP Inspection Team during the course of its various inspections may issue a Notice of Violation when a violation of the fire code and other related codes, standards, or ordinances has been disclosed.  A reinspection of the violation, which is charged against the property owner or violator, will be conducted until such time that the violation has been abated.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: The BFP Inspection Team submits inspection reports of the Notice of Violation issued and the follow-up inspections that were entered into a database.  The Program's secretary monitors and processes bills/notices to the violators or property owners. Timing:  Inspection reports are processed daily. Database reports are available as needed.

Strategic Goal: Provide the Highest Level of Service
Measure Title: Roll time of first ALS-capable company to Code 3  incidents requiring possible medical care, in seconds - 90th Percentile
Measure Description: SFFD EMS first ALS response time is measured from the time the PSAP (Public Safety Answering Point) notifies the first response unit until the first arriving Advanced Life Support engine or medic unit arrives on the scene.  Turnout time (to get gear and get on rig) is  included in these measurements.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Data is collected from the Emergency Communications Department's (ECD) 911 CAD.  Raw CAD data is stored at the ECD.  CAD data analysis reports are stored at SFFD Headquarters. Timing:  Data is available daiily. Information is reported on twice a year.

Strategic Goal: Provide the Highest Level of Service
Measure Title: Roll time of first unit to respond to Code 3 incidents, in seconds - 90th percentile
Measure Description: All calls dispatched to fire suppression staff, code 3 (emergency), measured from dispatch time the PSAP (Public Safety Answering Point) notifies the first response unit until the first arriving unit arrives on the scene.  Roll Time includes turnout time as a component of overall response time. 90th Percentile.  Measure of the total response that the Department controls.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Data is collected from the Emergency Communications Department's (ECD) 911 CAD.  Raw CAD data is stored at the ECD.  CAD data analysis reports are stored at SFFD Headquarters. Timing:  Data is available daiily. Information is reported on twice a year.

Strategic Goal: Provide the Highest Level of Service
Measure Title: Total arson arrests
Measure Description: Total adults arrested for arson.  Measure does not include juvenile fire setters, who are sentenced differently and often admitted into community service/rehabilitation programs.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Accounting of Fire Investigation reporting factors, from Bureau of Fire Investigation, SFPD and District Attorney records.  Verified by the Captain of the Bureau of Fire Inspection. Timing:  Data is collected daily and reported on monthly and biannually.

Strategic Goal: Provide the Highest Level of Service
Measure Title: Total number of arson incidents
Measure Description: NEW in Budget FY07.    Total number of arson incidents.  Arson investigators respond to every greater alarm (2nd Alarm Fire or Higher) and all suspicious fires. After an examination of the evidence on the scene and appropriate additional investigative work, the investigator will determine whether it is arson.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Recorded by Arson Investigators located at Evans street. Timing:  Data is collected daily and reported on monthly and biannually.

Strategic Goal: Provide the Highest Level of Service
Measure Title: Total number of responses to emergency incidents
Measure Description: All Department Responses to emergency incidents.  Each incident may have more than one unit responding to it.  This includes all Department apparatus.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Data is collected from the Emergency Communications Department's (ECD) 911 Computer Aided Dispatch (CAD).  Raw CAD data is stored at the ECD.  CAD data analysis reports are stored at SFFD Headquarters. Timing:  Data is available daily. Information is reported on twice a year.

Strategic Goal: Provide the Highest Level of Service
Measure Title: Total number of responses to emergency incidents
Measure Description: All Department Responses to emergency incidents.  Each incident may have more than one unit responding to it.  This includes all Department apparatus.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Data is collected from the Emergency Communications Department's (ECD) 911 Computer Aided Dispatch (CAD).  Raw CAD data is stored at the ECD.  CAD data analysis reports are stored at SFFD Headquarters. Timing:  Data is available daily. Information is reported on twice a year.

Strategic Goal: Provide the Highest Level of Service
Measure Title: Total response time (CRI) of first unit to Code 3 incidents requiring possible medical care, in seconds - 90th percentile
Measure Description: All Code 3 calls dispatched requiring possible medical care,  measured from call entry (when the fire/EMS call taker answers the call) to arrival on scene by the first responding unit (CRI).  (CRI="Critical Response Interval")    Includes turnout time as a component of overall response time.  90th percentile.  Measure represents response of emergency services from the prespective of the public.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Data is collected from the Emergency Communications Department's (ECD) 911 CAD.  Raw CAD data is stored at the ECD.  CAD data analysis reports are stored at SFFD Headquarters. Timing:  Data is available daiily. Information is reported on twice a year.

Measure Description: Average customer wait time in the lobby.

Strategic Goal: Ensure operational excellence
Measure Title: Average time to answer telephone calls (in seconds)
Measure Description: Average amount of time to answer telephone calls, in seconds.  Industry standard is less than 30 seconds.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Avaya Call Monitoring System generates reports showing the number of calls received for specified period and the average speed to answer.  Data are available immediately after the end of the reporting date.  Reports are generated monthly and reported at the Health Service Board meeting.  This metric is the average time callers waited to get an answer from an agent.

Strategic Goal: Ensure operational excellence
Measure Title: Call abandonment rate
Measure Description: Call abandonment rate.  Industry standard is less than 5%.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Avaya Call Monitoring System generates reports showing the number of calls abandoned for specified period.  Data are available immediately after the end of the reporting date.  Reports are generated monthly and reported at the Health Service Board meeting.  Abandonment rate is the percentage of callers who hang up before receiving an answer.

Measure Title: Percentage  of appeals responded to within 60 days and appeals not reaching the Health Service Board
Measure Description: Response to written member appeals.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Manual Log at HSS Office Timing:  Appeals are logged as received, staff works on research and resolution and logs appropriate date(s).  Data is compiled as received.  Appeals can include areas of eligibility, benefit coverage, and benefit payments.

Strategic Goal: Promote an informed, transparent, effective governance
Measure Title: Number of findings of audit reports with reportable material weakness in annual external and internal audit
Measure Description: Number of audit reports with reportable  material weaknesses.  KPMG year-end audit  and Controller's Office post audits of FAMIS & ADPICS documents. FAMIS is an accounting system used citywide by the City and County of San Francisco. ADPICS is a purchasing system. Purchasing transactions flow from ADPICS into FAMIS.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: KPMG Audit Report and Controller's Audit Letter (a letter from auditors to management where any audit issues are addressed)

Strategic Goal: Promote an informed, transparent, effective governance
Measure Title: Percentage of accounts current in premium payments (deliquent less than 60 days)
Measure Description: Changed Feb 07 per BOS Dec 2006 hearing.  All members are current with their premium payments, and delinquencies if any are not for 60 days or more.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: PeopleSoft Query  - HSS Office Timing:  Delinquencies are identified on a monthly basis and delinquency notices are mailed monthly.  Accounts are terminated when payments are not received by specified due date.

Strategic Goal: Promote an informed, transparent, effective governance
Measure Title: Percentage of invoices aged greater than 30 days
Measure Description: City's prompt payment policy requires payment of invoices within 30 days of receipt.  This measure shows the percentage of invoices (voucher payables) older than 30 days.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: EIS Continuous Monitoring Report "Invoice Aging Against Purchase Orders"

Strategic Goal: Permanent Supportive Housing
Measure Title: Number of adults leaving homelessness due to placement in permanent supportive housing
Measure Description: The number of adult households and transition-age-youth households placed in permanent housing and rent subsidy programs.
Measure Methodology: Follows HSH HOMstat methodology, adult and TAY households, excludes housing ladder.

Measure Description: The estimated number of family households placed in rapid rehousing rental programs
Measure Methodology: Follows HSH HOMstat methodology, family households.
Data Notes: Data reported as of 12/07/2021.

Strategic Goal: Temporary Shelter
Measure Title: Percent of case managed families in individual room shelters that are placed in permanent or transitional housing, enter a treatment program, or reunite with family
Measure Description: Supportive services provided at shelters are intended to assist in stabilizing the lives of clients so they are better able to secure permanent housing.  Cases managers are assigned to clients to help them identify and overcome barriers to obtaining permanent housing.  The three outcomes listed above are the main avenues through which case managers guide clients to leave the shelters and enter more permanent housing arrangements.  This measure is calculated by counting the number clients with case managers that achieve one of the three outcomes and then divided the total who exit the program.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: The shelter supportive services and case managers are funded through HSA, but directly administered through third-party, non-profit agencies.  These non-profits are under contract with HSA to submit quarterly reports detailing the number of case managed clients  that achieve one of the three described outcomes during the period. HSA stores two copies of past quarterly reports from the third-party non-profit agencies, one within the Contracts Unit, and one within the Division of Housing and Homelessness. Timing:  Quarterly and annually

Strategic Goal: Temporary Shelter
Measure Title: Percentage of all available year-round adult homeless shelter beds used
Measure Description: This is the average percentage of shelter beds (single adult) available that have been reserved and used on a nightly basis.
Measure Methodology: Data for this measure is derived from the CHANGES shelter bed reservation system.

Strategic Goal: Temporary Shelter
Measure Title: Percentage of all available year-round adult homeless shelter beds used
Measure Description: This is the average percentage of shelter beds (single adult) available that have been reserved and used on a nightly basis.
Measure Methodology: Data for this measure is derived from the CHANGES shelter bed reservation system.

Strategic Goal: Temporary Shelter
Measure Title: Percentage of all available year-round adult homeless shelter beds used
Measure Description: This is the average percentage of shelter beds (single adult) available that have been reserved and used on a nightly basis.
Measure Methodology: Data for this measure is derived from the CHANGES shelter bed reservation system.

Strategic Goal: Temporary Shelter
Measure Title: Percentage of all available year-round adult homeless shelter beds used
Measure Description: This is the average percentage of shelter beds (single adult) available that have been reserved and used on a nightly basis.
Measure Methodology: Data for this measure is derived from the CHANGES shelter bed reservation system.
Data Notes: The results for fiscal year 2020-21 may not be comparable to previous years. This measure was previously calculated using the CHANGES shelter management system that served adult shelters. In fiscal year 2020-21, the Citys COVID-19 emergency response created new sites and services managed in other data systems. These systems did not consistently track bed/room occupancy and bed/room inventory day-to-day. As a result, the department could not the calculate occupancy rate in the same way. The result of 96% reflects an estimated point-in-time occupancy rate of shelter-in-place hotels as of July 29, 2021. The department suggests that this occupancy rate is a good approximation for all adult shelters.

Strategic Goal: Champion diversity, fairness and equity
Measure Title: Average rating increase before/after workshop on familiarity of Diversity, Inclusion and Equity concepts
Measure Description: Average rating from participants' self-assessment on understanding the concepts of diversity, inclusion and equity after attending our Implicit Bias training program
Measure Methodology: Participants in every session fill out a self-assessment section on learning Before and After the training using a 5 point scale. 1= None or very low level knowledge/understanding

Strategic Goal: Champion diversity, fairness and equity
Measure Title: Percentage of discrimination complaints investigated/closed within 6 months of receipt
Measure Description: Complaints completed during the fiscal year and completed within six months of filing. Excludes MTA complaints.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Claimants and Departments report discrimination complaints to DHR.  DHR logs complaints recording the date of filing and assigns the complaints for review and investigation.  Upon completion, the HR Director's resolution of the complaint and date of such resolution is recorded. Timing:  Data on status of current complaints is available at any time.

Strategic Goal: Design and implement user-friendly practices
Measure Title: Average rating by departments of their claims administration services (1-5 scale)
Measure Description: Measure implemented in FY04-05:  Percentage of departmental workers' compensation coordinators (WCC) that answer excellent or good, on a 4-point scale (excellent, good, fair or poor).   8/31/05: Changed by DHR to an average satisfaction rating by departments using a 5 point scale, which matches the scale used in other DHR surveys (1=fair, 3=average, 5=excellent).
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: After the close of the fiscal year, WCC's are asked to complete a brief email survey on the quality of claims administration services (overall, and separately by Workers Compensation Division and the third party administrator).  Timing:  The survey is only conducted at fiscal year end. Data availability depends on timeliness of survey responses, but is generally within 8 weeks of the fiscal year end.

Strategic Goal: Design and implement user-friendly practices
Measure Title: Average time between department submission and SHR's initial response, in days
Measure Description: Time lapse (in days) from (a) the submission of an Authorization to Adopt Electronic Service Request to (b) the initial response from the Selection and Hiring Resources Operations team.
Measure Methodology: Pull data from the SmartPDF system comparing the time from (a) the submission of an Authorization to Adopt Electronic Service Request to (b) the initial response from the Selection and Hiring Resources Operations team. This data includes an average of Class Based Testing (CBT) and Position Based Testing (PBT) list adoption requests from multiple departments.

Strategic Goal: Improve employee well-being, satisfaction and engagement
Measure Title: Average rating increase before/after workshop on knowledge/understanding of how to effectively coach employees
Measure Description: Average rating from participants' self-assessment on understanding how to coach and manage employees before and after attending our 24 Plus for Supervisors and Managers program
Measure Methodology: During the final week of the 24 Plus program participants fill out a self-assessment section on learning Before and After the training using a 5 point scale. 1= None or very low level knowledge/understanding

Strategic Goal: Improve employee well-being, satisfaction and engagement
Measure Title: Average rating of DHR workshops by participants (1-5 scale)
Measure Description: Average rating on a scale from 1-5 that participants provide at the end of DHR training.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Participant Feedback Worksheet, Question 1 -- "How would you rate the workshop as a whole?" The Worksheet uses a 5-point scale: 1=fair, 3=average, 5=excellent. This Worksheet has been used by the training staff for several years. Timing:  Data are available at any time.

Strategic Goal: Improve employee well-being, satisfaction and engagement
Measure Title: Claims per 100 FTEs (full time equivalents)
Measure Description: The number of claims filed per 100 FTEs (full time equivalents) during the measurement period, excluding MTA and future medical claims.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Claims data are stored in VOS, the City's claims management information system. FTE counts are available from Financial Reporting (EIS) 80.001 Labor Report. Timing:  Data are available on an ongoing basis.

Measure Description: The number of claims filed per 100 FTEs (full time equivalents) during the measurement period, excluding MTA and future medical claims.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Claims data are stored in VOS, the City's claims management information system. FTE counts are available from Financial Reporting (EIS) 80.001 Labor Report. Timing:  Data are available on an ongoing basis.

Measure Title: Percent of grievances proceeding to arbitration in which the City prevails

Strategic Goal: Partner with others to solve problems
Measure Title: Percent of identified policy initiatives implemented through MOUs and other mechanisms
Measure Description: The proportion of policy initiatives identified at the start of the fiscal year that are incorporated into labor agreements (MOUs) or adopted through other mechanisms during the year, including ordinances, Charter provisions, Civil Service Rules, and administrative policies and procedures.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Policy goals and initiatives will be set at the beginning of the fiscal year and tracked for implementation. Timing:  Achievement of the goals in a fiscal year will be evaluated at fiscal year end.

Strategic Goal: Retain top talent while shaping the future workforce
Measure Title: Average time between examination announcement closing and list adoption, in months
Measure Description: The average (mean) number of calendar days (for all recruitments leading to permanent, civil service employment), representing the time period between the final closing date of a non-continuous recruitment (i.e., a discrete announcement for a job opportunity) and the adoption date of the eligible list produced as a result of that recruitment (from which hires are made).
Measure Methodology: Collection Method:  An automated applicant and announcement system (JobAps) collects the data, from which reports can be run.  From these reports, the announcement closing date value (i.e., the last date to file an application for the announcement) is subtracted from the list adoption date value (the date the list of qualified eligibles/candidates is made public) and the average number of days is then determined across all lists.  This number is then divided by 30 to convert the time period from days to months.  The measure is typically assessed at the end of each fiscal year.

Measure Title: Number of position classifications in the Civil Service Plan
Measure Description: Number of job codes/position classifications in the Civil Service Plan.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Data are stored in the City's Human Resources Information System (queried from the ASOXP db using the Job Code Index report. SF_JOB_INDEX_COMMN. Includes Board/Commissioner classes 0110-0118). Timing:  Data are available at any time.

Strategic Goal: Retain top talent while shaping the future workforce
Measure Title: Percent of wage rate calculations not requiring pay corrections
Measure Description: Percent of off-matrix (i.e. manual) salary grade calculations that are calculated correctly and do not result in either underpayment or overpayment of employees. The number of erroneous pay grades under which employees were paid divided by the total number of manually-calculated pay grades in the period.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Staff will track errors

Strategic Goal: Retain top talent while shaping the future workforce
Measure Title: Percentage of employees that are provisional
Measure Description: Percentage of Provisional appointments to total workforce excluding employees with as-needed work schedules.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Human Resources Information System query MRG_TPV_APPTS data divided by query MRG_SUCCESSION_PLAN_DEPT data and SFMTA business units, excluding as-needed employees and employees of the Community College and School Districts. Run query 2 weeks after end of measurement period to include backdated appointment changes, particularly retirements. Note: Civil Service Commission report also excludes provisional appointments in MTA service critical classes. Timing:  Query can be run at any time, but especially at fiscal year end, it is important to wait two weeks after measurement period end to capture retirements and other changes.

Strategic Goal: Address Discrimination Concerns of Public
Measure Title: Total Inquiries & Intakes (Civil Rights Division - CRD)
Measure Description: This number represents the total number of inquiries and intakes, regardless of outcome, processed by the Human Rights Commission Discrimination Division.
Measure Methodology: Enter the total number of inquiries and intakes, regardless of outcome, processed by the Human Rights Commission Discrimination Division during each fiscal quarter beginning on the first day of each quarter and ending on the last day of the quarter

Measure Title: Total Number of Complaints Filed and Settled
Measure Description: This number of represents the total number of complaints filed by the Human Rights Commission Discrimination Division on behalf of a complainant which HRC mediated and settled to the satisfaction of all parties to the complaint during each fiscal quarter beginning on the first day of each quarter and ending on the last day of the quarter.
Measure Methodology: Enter the total number of complaints filed by the Human Rights Commission Discrimination Division on behalf of a complainant which HRC mediated and settled to the satisfaction of all parties to the complaint during each fiscal quarter beginning on the first day of each quarter and ending on the last day of the quarter.

Strategic Goal: Enable all families with children 0-5 years old to access Affordable high quality early care and education (OECE)
Measure Title: Percent of children ages 0 to 5 enrolled in City-funded high quality ECE programs
Measure Description: City-funded high quality ECE programs are those in ELS/PFA because such programs are committed to quality and receiving city funding.  The numerator is all child care subsidized children in CC3 and Cocoa enrollment systems that are part of ELS or PFA.  This includes ELS, PFA, and voucher data.  Non-ELS voucher enrollments are excluded. The denominator is based on the most recent 5-year ACS (2016 5-Year ACS) looking at the estimate of all children age 0-5 and not enrolled in kindergarten.  The denominator is adjusted to 75% of the estimate because 75% participation rate in public kindergarten is a more reasonable threshold given data limitations.  Many children do not participate in public child care and only city-funded providers are assessed using the QRIS. New York City applies this adjustment to calculate their penetration rate.
Measure Methodology: City-funded high quality ECE programs are those in ELS/PFA because such programs are committed to quality and receiving city funding.  The numerator is all child care subsidized children in CC3 and Cocoa enrollment systems that are part of ELS or PFA.  This includes ELS, PFA, and voucher data.  Non-ELS voucher enrollments are excluded. The denominator is based on the most recent 5-year ACS (2016 5-Year ACS) looking at the estimate of all children age 0-5 and not enrolled in kindergarten.  The denominator is adjusted to 75% of the estimate because 75% participation rate in public kindergarten is a more reasonable threshold given data limitations.  Many children do not participate in public child care and only city-funded providers are assessed using the QRIS. New York City applies this adjustment to calculate their penetration rate.

Strategic Goal: Enable all families with children 0-5 years old to access Affordable high quality early care and education (OECE)
Measure Title: Percent of subsidy-eligible children ages 0 to 5 receiving subsidies
Measure Description: The numerator is all child care subsidized children in CC3 and Cocoa enrollment systems.  This includes ELS and voucher data.  ELS Moderate enrollments (85% SMI-110% AMI) are omitted from the numerator.  Only 5% of PFA enrollments are included because it is a universal program without means testing and 5% is an estimate of lower-income enrollments. The denominator is based on the most recent 5-year ACS looking at the estimate of children age 0-5 and not in kindergarten, and <85%  SMI to align with the most common subsidy eligibility.
Measure Methodology: The numerator is all child care subsidized children in CC3 and Cocoa enrollment systems.  This includes ELS and voucher data.  ELS Moderate enrollments (85% SMI-110% AMI) are omitted from the numerator.  Only 5% of PFA enrollments are included because it is a universal program without means testing and 5% is an estimate of lower-income enrollments. The denominator is based on the most recent 5-year ACS looking at the estimate of children age 0-5 and not in kindergarten, and <85%  SMI to align with the most common subsidy eligibility.

Strategic Goal: Help residents access employment (DHS)
Measure Title: CalWorks: Current active CalWORKs caseload
Measure Description: This measure is the number of CalWORKs cases that have received cash assistance (TANF) during the month for which the data is reported.
Measure Methodology: Data for this measure is obtained from a monthly extract generated by the CalWIN client tracking system.

Strategic Goal: Help residents access employment (DHS)
Measure Title: WDD: Job placement rate for aided individuals receiving Workforce Development Division Services
Measure Description: HSA 2006 - This measure is calculated by taking the number of aided individuals (CalWORKs or PAES recipients) that have been placed in a job divided by the number of those individuals referred to the WDD from cash assistance programs.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Data for all placements are tracked by the Workforce Development Division in a log and specialized database and then reported to the Planning Unit. Timing:  Data for this measure is compiled on a monthly basis and is available for the prior month.

Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Data for all placements are tracked by the Workforce Development Division in a log and specialized database and then reported to the Planning Unit. Timing:  Data for this measure is compiled on a monthly basis and is available for the prior month.

Strategic Goal: Help residents reach economic stability (DHS)
Measure Title: CAAP: Number of CAAP SSI Case Mgmt clients exiting county cash aid due to receipt of federal SSI benefits
Measure Description: This is the cumulative number of individuals during the period that received HSA's internal SSI Advocacy services and are discontinued from CAAP due to receipt of SSI benefits. The number is determined based upon the receipt of award letters from SSA.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: HSA's SSI Case Management Program (SSI-CM) maintains a client tracking spreadsheet and tracks which clients are awarded SSI based on award letters and other communications with SSA.  Timing: Data is gathered on an ongoing basis and awards are tallied on a monthly basis.

Strategic Goal: Help residents reach economic stability (DHS)
Measure Title: CAAP: Percent of CAAP participants who left aid due to earned income from employment
Measure Description: Percent of County Adult Assistance Programs (CAAP) recipients who left aid due to increased earnings from employment.
Measure Methodology: The denominator is an unduplicated count of individuals who received CAAP benefits in each fiscal year. The numerator is the number of CAAP recipients who discontinued from CAAP and had earnings in the quarter of their discontinuance. The quarterly earnings data is from the California Employment Development Department (EDD). The data on CAAP recipients and discontinuances is from the San Francisco Human Service Agencys CalWIN data system. The numerator is obtained by matching records in the CalWIN data and EDD data.

Strategic Goal: Help residents reach economic stability (DHS)
Measure Title: CalFresh: Current active CalFresh caseload
Measure Description: This is the total number of cases receiving non-assistance food stamps.  Non-assistance food stamps cases do not include those cases which also receive other forms of public assistance (e.g. CalWORKs).
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Data for this measure is tracked within the CalWIN system.  A case file is opened at the point of intake and maintained while the case is active. Timing:  The CalWIN data system is dynamic, and can be queried for current data.  Historical data is stored in extracts that can also be queried for previous periods.

Strategic Goal: Help residents reach economic stability (DHS)
Measure Title: CalWorks: Percent of CalWORKs families who left aid due to earned income from employment
Measure Description: Percent of families participating in CalWORKs who left aid due to increased earnings from employment.
Measure Methodology: The denominator is an unduplicated count of families that received CalWORKs benefits in each fiscal year. The numerator is the number of CalWORKs families who discontinued from CalWORKs and had earnings in the quarter of their discontinuance. The quarterly earnings data is from the California Employment Development Department (EDD), while the data on CalWORKs recipients and discontinuances is from the San Francisco Human Service Agencys CalWIN data system. The numerator is matching records in the CalWIN data and EDD data.

Strategic Goal: Improve outcomes for children in the child welfare system (DHS)
Measure Title: FCS: Percent of children discharged from foster care to permanency within 12 months (out of all children who entered care during a 12-month period)

Measure Methodology: Results reported by UC Berkeley using data from the CA Department of Social Services. Includes all children reunified, adapoted, and entering guardianship during the fiscal year (July thru June). Reports can be found online at http://cssr.berkeley.edu/ucb_childwelfare/P1.aspx

Strategic Goal: Improve outcomes for children in the child welfare system (DHS)
Measure Title: FCS: Percent of long-term foster care children discharged to permanency (out of all children who had been in care for at least 24 months)
Measure Description: Of all children in care on the first day of the 12-month period who had been in care for 24 months or more, the percent discharged to permanency within 12 months.Includes all children reunified, adapoted, and entering guardianship. Results reported by UC Berkeley using data from the CA Department of Social Services. Reports can be found online at http://cssr.berkeley.edu/ucb_childwelfare/P3.aspx
Measure Methodology: Of all children in care on the first day of the 12-month period who had been in care for 24 months or more, the percent discharged to permanency within 12 months. Includes all children reunified, adapoted, and entering guardianship during the fiscal year (July thru June). Results reported by UC Berkeley using data from the CA Department of Social Services. Reports can be found online at http://cssr.berkeley.edu/ucb_childwelfare/P3.aspx

Strategic Goal: Improve service delivery, operations, and client experience (DHS)
Measure Title: Personnel: Number of employees for whom performance appraisals were scheduled
Measure Description: New measure requested by Mayor on 8/15/05.  This is the number of employees in a department for whom a performance appraisal is to be conducted.  DHR policy is that all permanent and provisional employees must have an annual appraisal.  For new employees, the first review should be scheduled according to their applicable probationary period.  For other employees, reviews should be conducted every 12 months. Departments can do appraisals for temporary employees at their discretion.  9/11/09  All future data reporting will be based soley on those PAR's required for the correspodning time period.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: In March 2006 HSA developed a Performance Evaluation System. We created an Access Database using our Excel based Position Control data.  We implemented the system beginning in April 2006.  In May 2006 we made enhancements to the Access Database and were able to link directly to our Position Control spreadsheet which has all of the department's positions listed, which is about 1, 710 filled. Timing:  Current

Strategic Goal: Improve service delivery, operations, and client experience (DHS)
Measure Title: Personnel: Number of employees for whom scheduled performance appraisals were completed
Measure Description: New measure requested by Mayor on 8/15/05.  This is the number of applicable employees in a department for whom a performance appraisal was conducted amd completed during the fiscal year.  "Completed" means an appraisal form has been filled out and is in the employee's personnel file.  DHR policy is that all permanent and provisional employees must have an annual appraisal.  For new employees, the first review should be scheduled according to their applicable probationary period.  For other employees, reviews should be conducted every 12 months.   Departments can do appraisals for temporary employees at their discretion.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: In March 2006 HSA developed a Performance Evaluation System. We created an Access Database using our Excel based Position Control data.  We implemented the system beginning in April 2006.  In May 2006 we made enhancements to the Access Database and were able to link directly to our Position Control spreadsheet which has all of the department's positions listed, which is about 1, 710 filled. Timing:  Current

Strategic Goal: Improve service delivery, operations, and client experience (DHS)
Measure Title: Personnel: Percent of required bilingual positions filled
Measure Description: This measure attempts to reflect the Human Services Agency commitment to providing access to services for individuals with limited English Proficiency.  Furthermore, the Department is legislatively mandated to provide access.  Division 21 states, "The number of public contact positions in each major occupational group shall be determined for each program and/or location whose non-English language cases equal or exceed five percent of the total cases for each program or location."  The Equal Access to Services Ordinance states, "...that City Departments would be required to provide services in non-English languages when (a) 10,000 City residents, (b) 5 percent or more of the clients served by the Department, or (c) 5 percent of the residents of the Supervisorial District in which the Departments' offices are located are limited to English-speaking and share a common language."
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Data for this measure is tracked in several places.  The personnel or staffing data is tracked by our Personnel Department in an Excel spreadsheet (personnel Control Report).  Caseload data is tracked in severl client tracking systems (CalWIN, CMIP, AACTS, and Panoramic). Timing:  Data for this measure is compiled annually.

Strategic Goal: Maintain strong network of community-based services (DAAS)
Measure Title: CLF: Number of unduplicated clients served by the Community Living Fund program in the past six months
Measure Description: Number of unduplicated clients who have received case management and/or purchased services through the Community Living Fund (CLF) program during the fiscal year.  The CLF program provides assistance to prevent institutionalization of to those individuals most at risk of being institutinalized.  Assistance may include, but not limited to, case management services as well as purchasing services such as assistive devices, home care, home modification, etc.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: DAAS contracts with community-based agencies to provide CLF services.  Contractors will maintain all active client records. Timing:  Data is available from contractors as needed for reporting.

Strategic Goal: Maintain strong network of community-based services (DAAS)
Measure Title: IHSS: Current active In Home Support Services caseload
Measure Description: HSA: In Home Support Services provides assistance to individuals that are aged, blind and/or disabled so that they may remain safely in their own homes.  This measure is simply a count of the individuals deemed eligible and have an active case opened.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: The data for this measure comes from the CMIPs database. Timing:  Monthly downloads from the State. It  is a count of all IHSS cases that have a status code of either I [Interim] or E [Eligible].

Strategic Goal: Maintain strong network of community-based services (DAAS)
Measure Title: IHSS: Percentage of IHSS applications processed within the mandated timeframe
Measure Description: This measure looks at the timeliness that services are delivered to IHSS recipients.  The measure specifically looks at the amount of time it takes to determine eligibility for services from the application date.  The measure is calculated by determining the number of days from the date of application to the date that the eligibility determination is made.  That number of days is compared to the mandated number of days (30 day for applicants who are "status eligibile" and 45 days for applicants who are "income eligibile").  The percentage shows the portion of the applications that had a determination established within the mandated timeframe.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: The HSA "ICIS" database documents application dates and eligibility determination dates as well as other data elements.  The Planning Unit runs reports from that dtabase on a quarterly basis for analysis purposes.  Timing: Data is available as needed.

Strategic Goal: Maintain strong network of community-based services (DAAS)
Measure Title: IHSS: Percentage of IHSS case reassessments completed within the mandated timeframe
Measure Description: In Home Support Services provides assistance to individuals that are aged, blind, and/or disabled so that they may remain safely in their own homes.  Cases are typically required to be reassessed within 12 months of the last face to face visit, but 6 month extensions are allowable for stable cases (for a total of 18 months).  This measure shows the percentage of cases that met those requirements.
Measure Methodology: The data for this measure comes from monthly assessment due and overdue reports that are provided by the California Department of Social Services.  Cases included in those reports are those that have a status code of "E" (eligible) or "L" (suspended).

Strategic Goal: Maintain strong network of community-based services (DAAS)
Measure Title: IR: Percentage of calls to the DAAS Information and Referral Line abandoned
Measure Description: This measure shows the percentage of all calls made to the Long Term Care Intake and Screening Unit that are abandoned by the caller before reaching an intake staff person or voicemail.
Measure Methodology: The program uses an automated call distribution system which provides regular reports of the total number of calls received and the number of calls abandoned.  Reports are available as needed.  This figure is the total number of calls abandoned divided by the total number of intake requests (all calls, in any language).

Strategic Goal: Maintain strong network of community-based services (DAAS)
Measure Title: OCP: Number of home-delivered meals provided to older people
Measure Description: Definition:  This is the actual number of meals delivered to individuals residence, typically elderly or chronically ill,  that need assistance with meal preparation.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: This data is tracked by the Office of Community Partnerships. Reported monthly to us by community providers and then summed up by OCP staff. Timing:  Data is gathered daily and then reported monthly by our community partners.

Strategic Goal: Maintain strong network of community-based services (DAAS)
Measure Title: OCP: Number of meals served at centers for older people
Measure Description: Number of congregate meals, that is, those meals served to seniors at congregate meal sites such as senior centers and community centers by community-based providers, under contract to the Department of Aging & Adult Services.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Reimbursement to providers is based on a per-unit (meal) fee.  Providers report units of service to the department in order to obtain payment. Timing:  Current and ongoing

Strategic Goal: Protect children from abuse and neglect (DHS)
Measure Title: FCS: Entry rate: Number of first-time entries to foster care per thousand children in the population
Measure Description: Results reported by UC Berkeley using data from the CA Department of Social Services. Results for previous calendar year. Reports can be found online at http://cssr.berkeley.edu/ucb_childwelfare/EntryRates.aspx
Measure Methodology: Results reported by UC Berkeley using data from the CA Department of Social Services. Reports can be found online at http://cssr.berkeley.edu/ucb_childwelfare/EntryRates.aspx

Strategic Goal: Protect children from abuse and neglect (DHS)
Measure Title: FCS: Total number of children in foster care
Measure Description: This measure provides a count of the number of children with an open case in foster care at the end of each month that data is being reported.
Measure Methodology: The data source for this measure is the Child Welfare Services Case Management System (CWS/CMS). CWS/CMS is a longitudinal statewide database that can be queried for current and historical data.

Strategic Goal: Protect populations from abuse, neglect, and financial exploitation (DAAS)
Measure Title: APS: Percentage of initial face to face visits that were completed or attempted within the mandated timeframe
Measure Description: New for FY 2015. APS workers are required to complete an initial face to face visit within a certain timeframe, depending on the nature of the report.  This metric shows the number of face to face visits that were completed within that time, or in which the worker went out within the designated response time but was unable to see the client in person.

Strategic Goal: Protect populations from abuse, neglect, and financial exploitation (DAAS)
Measure Title: PC: Percent of referrals that had a previous conservatorship within the prior year
Measure Description: This measures the lasting effectiveness of the PC's Office to effectively link clients with appropriate services in the community.  Indirectly, this measure also serves as an indicator to the availability and quality of community resources. This measure is calculated by comparing cases opened during the specified time period to those opened that had been previously conserved within the last 365 days.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Data for this measure is tracked and maintained within PC office on index cards.  Index cards are updated as needed or as an individual is reconserved. Timing:  Current and ongoing

Measure Description: Number of active cases that provide money management for frail elderly and adults with mental illness.  CON Jan 2006:  HSA requested to DELETE.  CON:  Kept, see/check MYR picks/comments (Sue Wong).
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Cases and case file information are tracked within the Panoramic database system. Timing:  The Panoramic database allows for querying of the database for current and historical information.

Strategic Goal: Provide consumer-centered programming to best address needs (DAAS)
Measure Title: CVSO: Number of unduplicated veterans that received assistance
Measure Description: This measure shows the unduplicated number of individuals receiving services and benefitting form County Veteran Services.  It is important to monitor this number because of the fluctuating proportion of veterans to the overall population, especially in light of the current conflict(s) in the Middle East.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Staff maintains a simple count, which is entered into a database.  Data is maintained on the network database at the Veterans Service Office at 875 Stevenson.  Data is gathered at the time of intake and then maintained over the length of the case. Timing:  Monthly reports

Strategic Goal: Provide a safe and secure environment for staff and detainees
Measure Title: Percent of Juvenile Justice Center youth grievances processed within two business days after filing
Measure Description: Providing a safe and secure environment for youth detained in the Juvenile Justice Center is important.  By processing youth grievances in a timely manner, small problems will be kept from becoming large problems and can be solved quickly.
Measure Methodology: The Juvenile Probation Department ombudsman provides a monthly report to the Department's Finance/HR units.

Strategic Goal: Reduce overtime expenditures in the entire department
Measure Title: Annual overtime expenditures
Measure Description: This measures the dollar amount the department spends on overtime each year.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Controller issues BRPEP reports that show annual results.  Department prepares monthly reports, extracting information from FAMIS, Controller BPREP reports and Department reports. Timing:  Data is tracked on Famis and TESS..

Strategic Goal: Successful Completion of Probation
Measure Title: Average length of stay (in days) from disposition to placement of youth in juvenile hall awaiting out of home placement
Measure Description: This is a calculation of the number of days the youth spends in Juvenile Hall  from the time the court orders out-of-home placement to actual placement.     Prior years' data was a calculation of the number of days from detention in Juvenile Hall to actual placement.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Data is tracked in the Juvenile Justice Information Sytem(JJIS).    It is a calculation of the days from court disposition to placement date. Timing:  Juvenile Justice Information System Ad-hoc Reports.

Strategic Goal: Utilize probation services and community resources to assist youth in successfully navigating probation.
Measure Title: Percentage of youth who successfully complete the Evening Report Center Programs
Measure Description: Evening Reporting Centers are a key component of Juvenile Probation's Alternative-to-Detention efforts.
Measure Methodology: JDAI Coordinator monitors the completion rate of the Evening Reporting Centers on a monthly basis and will report on a six-month basis, twice/year.

Strategic Goal: 1. Create a safer transportation experience for everyone
Measure Title: Muni collisions per 100,000 vehicle miles
Measure Description: Purpose:  To reduce accidents through effective operator training programs as well as effective accident follow-up training. Definition:  Track reduction in accidents as a result of more effective operator training and accident retraining.  Data include Federal Transit Administration reportable collisions.
Measure Methodology: Method:  Number of reportable revenue service collisions divided by revenue miles. Data will be reported to the Board on a quarterly basis. Timeframe: Data is available approximately 60 days after the each quarter closes. The annual goal for the forthcoming fiscal year is traditionally approved by the SFMTA Board of Directors in April or May. Service Standards Cross-Reference: C4

Strategic Goal: 1. Create a safer transportation experience for everyone
Measure Title: SFPD-reported Muni-related crimes per 100,000 miles
Measure Description: Purpose: To improve security throughout the Muni system by identifying and reducing criminal activity. Definition: The ratio of reported crimes to every 100,000 miles of service.
Measure Methodology: The number of incidents reported from the SFPD data warehouse are calculated as a ratio to every 100,000 revenue vehicle miles traveled, as reported through the SHOPS database.

Strategic Goal: 2. Make transit and other sustainable modes of transportation the most attractive and preferred means of travel
Measure Title: Muni total annual ridership
Measure Description: Purpose:  To measure ridership. Definition:  Annual measurement of the number of passengers who board the Municipal Railway?s revenue vehicles.  A passenger is counted each time they board a vehicle, even though they may be on the same journey from origin to destination.
Measure Methodology: Method:  Ride checkers are utilized to count passenger boardings. Timeframe: Data are gathered over the course of the year.  Unaudited results are available approximately 90 days after the end of the fiscal year. The annual goal for the forthcoming fiscal year is traditionally approved by the SFMTA Board of Directors in April or May. Service Standards Cross-Reference: B1

Strategic Goal: 2. Make transit and other sustainable modes of transportation the most attractive and preferred means of travel
Measure Title: Percentage of scheduled service hours delivered
Measure Description: Purpose: To measure service hours through available operators and equipment deployed in revenue service, along with the percentage of equipment available for service. Definition: Monthly measurement of the percent of total available hours for service measuring operators and equipment and percentage of equipment available daily.
Measure Methodology: Method:  Both operators and equipment are measured as to the total number of hours in service as a percentage of the total scheduled hours. Data come from the online dispatching system. Measurement of the vehicles that begin service at the scheduled time will be provided from the 8am and 6pm ?Not-Out Report? generated by Central Control and will show the percent of vehicles that went out at the scheduled time for both the AM and PM pullout. Timeframe: Data is available approximately 60 days after the each quarter closes. The annual goal for the forthcoming fiscal year is traditionally approved by the SFMTA Board of Directors in April or May. Service Standards Cross-Reference: A2

Strategic Goal: 2. Make transit and other sustainable modes of transportation the most attractive and preferred means of travel
Measure Title: Sustainable transportation mode share
Measure Description: Measuring the sustainable transportation mode share helps the SFMTA track its progress toward achieving San Franciscos Climate Action, Vision Zero, and Transit First policy goals and informs future efforts to make sustainable transportation modes the preferred means of travel. Sustainable transportation mode share is determined by dividing the number of sustainable modes (transit, walk, bike, taxi, and carshare) trips, by the total number of all trips estimated through the Travel Decision Survey and is reported city-wide.
Measure Methodology: The sum of [sustainable mode trips] divided by the sum of [all trips], expressed as a percentage. To see additional details, visit the SFMTA website at https://www.sfmta.com/reports/sustainable-transportation-mode-share

Measure Methodology: The sum of [sustainable mode trips] divided by the sum of [all trips], expressed as a percentage. To see additional details, visit the SFMTA website at https://www.sfmta.com/reports/sustainable-transportation-mode-share

Measure Methodology: The sum of [sustainable mode trips] divided by the sum of [all trips], expressed as a percentage. To see additional details, visit the SFMTA website at https://www.sfmta.com/reports/sustainable-transportation-mode-share

Strategic Goal: 4. Create a workplace that delivers outstanding service
Measure Title: Hazardous traffic signal reports: % responded to and repaired within two hours
Measure Description: Purpose:  To ensure the safety of all modes of transportation by responding quickly to complaints of hazardous traffic signal conditions. Definition:  During business hours, the Signal Shop enters malfunctions in a manual log and dispatches crews.  During other hours, calls are routed to the 24-hour hotline which logs the call and dispatches staff from the Department of Technology (DOT).  If the problem is major and urgent, DTIS pages a Signal Shop emergency crew to the scene.  Repair crews record their arrival time and the time the call is completed.
Measure Methodology: Method:  All complaints and service requests are maintained in a database system.  Reports are generated to determine average response rate. Timeframe: Data is available approximately 60 days after the each quarter closes. The annual goal for the forthcoming fiscal year is traditionally approved by the SFMTA Board of Directors in April or May. Service Standards Cross-Reference: A13 (FY08), A11 (FY09) Results are based on a non-probability sample from opt-in SFMTA online panel surveys.

Strategic Goal: 4. Create a workplace that delivers outstanding service
Measure Title: Parking meter malfunction reports: % responded to and repaired within 48 hours
Measure Description: Purpose:  To ensure consistent operation of parking meters and promptly repair inoperable meters. Definition:  Electronic parking meters are capable of self-reporting malfunctions.  In addition, a hotline number is posted on each meter to enable members of the public to report instances of malfunction directly to the meter shop.  These reporting mechanisms enable DPT to respond and repair meters in a timely and efficient manner to ensure the highest level of service to the public.
Measure Methodology: Method:  The San Francisco Parking Meter Management System (SFPM) is a work order system which automates requests for service and allows them to be tracked and compiled.  A report is generated providing the average response rate for all complaints received within a quarter. Timeframe: Data is available approximately 60 days after the each quarter closes. The annual goal for the forthcoming fiscal year is traditionally approved by the SFMTA Board of Directors in April or May. Service Standards Cross-Reference: A11 (FY08), A9 (FY09)

Strategic Goal: 4. Create a workplace that delivers outstanding service
Measure Title: Workplace injuries per 200,000 hours
Measure Description: Purpose: To improve workplace safety by tracking and reducing workplace injuries. Definition: The ratio of work-related injuries to every 200,000 work hours.
Measure Methodology: Data on injuries are reported from the workers compensation claims database and calculated as a ratio to every 200,000 work hours.

Strategic Goal: Improve Responsiveness
Measure Title: Median Response Time to Priority A Calls (Minutes)
Measure Description: Measure of how fast, at the 50th percentile, police units respond to 9-1-1 calls once the 9-1-1 center at DEM has received the call. Priority A calls only. Median number of minutes from CALL_RECEIVED to first unit ON_SCENE. Priority A calls only.
Measure Methodology: Median number of minutes from CALL_RECEIVED to first unit ON_SCENE. Priority A calls only. Removed calls with no on_scene timestamp, and calls from certain stations that are not SFPD. HSOC calls (3L) not included. Contact Office of the Controller for more information.

Measure Methodology: Median number of minutes from CALL_RECEIVED to first unit ON_SCENE. Priority A calls only. Removed calls with no on_scene timestamp, and calls from certain stations that are not SFPD. HSOC calls (3L) not included. Contact Office of the Controller for more information.

Strategic Goal: Improve Responsiveness
Measure Title: Number of collisions where the officer is at fault
Measure Description: A count of the number of officer involved vehicle collisions where the officer was determined to be at fault. Collisions are reviewed by Dept. Accident Board of Review to determine training or discipline required.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Data is selected from traffic collision reports and entered into the Department Accident Board of review (DABOR ) database, maintained at SFPD Traffic Division.  Officer Sally Foster (553-1198) maintains statistics on DABOR dispositions. Timing:  Monthly.

Strategic Goal: Improve Responsiveness
Measure Title: Number of moving citations issued
Measure Description: Number of moving citations issued.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Data is hand counted .  A summary report is received from each district station counting issuances for a given period by selected violations and entered into a master worksheet maintained by traffic company. Timing:  Monthly.

Strategic Goal: Measure and Communicate
Measure Title: Firearm seizures
Measure Description: The number of firearms collected by SFPD.  A major goal of SFPD is to remove all firearms off the street.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Every firearm seized is collected, tracked, and recorded by Crime Scene Investigation (CSI).  Paper forms are used for this record keeping. Timing:  Crime Scene Investigation prepares a monthly spreadsheet , by District, displaying the types of firearms seized.  Data is available at the end of each month.

Strategic Goal: Measure and Communicate
Measure Title: Number of 'driving under the influence' arrests
Measure Description: This is the number of arrests made for "driving under the influence" ( this includes DUI-Alcohol or Drugs, as primary or subsequent charge)..
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Traffic Company hand-counts  reports and maintains a master file involving DUI charges. Timing:  Aggregate data is available at the end of each month.

Strategic Goal: Measure and Communicate
Measure Title: UCR:  Number of UCR homicides per 100,000 population
Measure Description: Number of UCR Homicides per 100,000 Population. UCR Homicide definition: The willful and non-negligent killing of one human being by another = murder and non-negligent manslaughter.  This does not include:  fetal deaths, traffic fatalities, accidental deaths, assaults to murder, attempts to murder.
Measure Methodology: Collection Method: Number of Homicides divided by current San Francisco population and multiplied by 100,000.  Population FY 2008: 829,848, FY 2009 & FY 2010: 842,265 (Source: CA Department of Finance E-2 Report).
